description:
Hi,

 

Pay attention: the meeting has been re-scheduled at 6.45 pm (at 7pm the building is locked). The room is just behind the lift at the 8th floor. Many thanks to the group of Bontempi Gianluca who accepted to host this meeting. Note that the parking lot UAE (see map) is accessible for those of you coming by car.

 

The agenda for the new startup meeting is:
- discussing the objectives of RBelgium
- discussing the 2 recently launched projects (objectives, people involved,how?)
- discussing the agenda of the kickoff meeting which will be held at the beginning of the new academic year

RBelgium is a collaborative community where everybody's voice is listened. So even if you don't want to be part of the decisional team but still want to suggest something do not hesitate.

Looking forward to seeing you.

JB

venue.name: Room 2NO-800G
venue.address_1: ULB CAMPUS, Building NO (IT department), 8th floor

name: startup meeting

description:
Dear all,

The next RBelgium Regular Meeting has been scheduled to take place on Friday, November 16, at 6:45 pm. The location will be the same as for the startup meeting, i.e., at ULB Campus de la Plaine.

The RBelgium Regular Meetings are sessions of informal talks given on any subject and any level of R experience. The meetings are open to everyone with a passion for R. The main aim of these meetings is to get to know each other better, and to learn from each other through sharing and discussing.

Do not hesitate to contact us for further questions, or for presentation proposals/requests. Any input from your side would be greatly appreciated!

We hope to see you there!

Best regards,
RBelgium

 

We are pleased to announce the schedule of the upcoming RBelgium Regular meeting:

* Graphical User Interface developments around R, including tcltk2 and SciViews - Philippe Grosjean (UMons)
* Using R via the Amazon Cloud - Jean-Baptiste Poullet (stat'Rgy)
* Literature review: R books - Brecht Devleesschauwer (UGent, UCL)

venue.name: Room 2NO-800G
venue.address_1: ULB CAMPUS, Building NO (IT department), 8th floor

name: Regular Meeting / November 2012

description:
We are thankful to the Statistical Methods and Computing Service SMCS at UCL and to Christian Ritter in particular for hosting this new RBelgium meeting. Sandwiches will be provided to the participants.

 

Here is the agenda:

Christian Ritter (Prof. at UCL)

Title: The Belgian BeeR Challenge
An idea to create a Belgian R package containing small useful extensions for everyday use.

Description:
Has the following ever happened to you?

You found a nice method in R, for example running medians (runmed) to
quickly filter out some extreme values, just to discover that it doesn't accept the 'na.rm' argument and breaks on missing cells? There are many
functions in many packages which break on 'real life' and we always have
to write our own little routines around them to do what we want.

So I bet that you have already written many little functions to extend
what is provided by default. They are somewhere on your computer, maybe
assembled in some sort of folder or even converted into a private
package. I have a challenge for you: Let's share them, document them,
and package them to share them. Let's brew BeeR, the Belgian extensions
to R.

What should be the reward for those who participate? A nice dinner per
year with good beer?

Let's talk about it on 15 March

 

Pierre Dupont (Prof. at UCL)

- UCL Machine learning group presentation

- R for machine learning and in research


Eric Lecoutre (Senior Consultant at Business & Decision)

Title: RT: #tweets analysis with R - #text-mining flavor

 

Description: Idea is to show how R can be effectively used for text-mining in particular in the context of tweets analysis.

 

 

 

Hope to see you there.

 

The RBelgium team.

venue.name: Statistical Methods and Computing Service SMCS (UCL)
venue.address_1: Rue des Wallons 6 3rd floor Room D-319

how_to_find_us: Entrance to the building opposite of the exit of the railway station between a decoration store and a sandwich shop.
name: RBelgium meeting 3

description:
We are very thankful to the Department of Econometrics and in particular to Professor Christophe Croux and Jonathan Cornelissen for inviting us. PARKING: The group of Prof. Croux arranged to have free access to the parking inside the building of the Faculty of Business and Economics. You can enter that parking in the Vlamingenstraat:http://goo.gl/maps/vZh5J. Then move to the building closest to Naamsestraat. Alternatively, there is a paying parking "Parking Heilig Hart" at Naamsestraat: http://goo.gl/maps/WtcqZ
FOOD/DRINKS: Don't worry. There will be all you need ;). It is also provided by Prof. Croux.
TALKS: ** Jonathan Cornelissen - DataMind

Discover DataMind, a new online learning platform for data analysis and R, developed by a group of Belgian R enthusiasts!

http://www.datamind.org/

** Tobias Verbeke (OpenAnalytics) - The R Service Bus

R is the statistical computing environment of choice but in many contexts statistical analyses need to be triggered in automated business processes or workflows.

The R Service Bus is a communication middleware and work manager for R that allows to plug R into such processes independently of the technology used. Several use cases will be demonstrated where the R Service Bus has proven its value, and some technical details will be given on how integration exercises have been tackled in industry.

http://www.openanalytics.eu/r-service-bus
http://rsb.doc.openanalytics.eu/dev/

** JB Poullet - update on RBelgium activities
We look forward to seeing you all once again, and to change thoughts on these two wonderful R tools!
RBelgium
how_to_find_us: The room is HOGM 01.85. If you enter from Naamsestraat, the entrance is in front of you at the left side. http://www.kuleuven.be/lokalen/50074937.htm.
name: RBelgium meeting 4

description:
We have the pleasure to announce that the Faculty of Psychology and Educational Sciences (UGent) will be hosting the 5th RBelgium regular meeting! We are grateful to Jan Lammertyn, Maarten De Schryver and Prof Yves Rosseel for organizing this meeting, and to Story Scientia for sponsoring the meeting.

SCHEDULE

• 19h-19h15: Joris Meys - From Excel to R: Getting started with R package XLConnect

• 19h45-20h15: Mark Demesmaeker (Director Industry Analytics at TIBCO Spotfire) - Added value of analytics and R in business and industry (webcast)

• 20h45-21h45: Yves Rosseel - Latent Variable Analysis with R package lavaan

-- Sandwiches, snacks and drinks will be provided during the meeting

CARPOOL

People wishing to attend the meeting but requiring a lift to Ghent, may post a carpool request in the message box below.

PUBLIC TRANSPORT

Bus 9 makes a direct connection between the Gent-Sint-Pieters train station and the meeting location. More possibilities are listed here (in Dutch).

venue.name: PC-lokaal 1 (opposite main building of the Faculty of Psychology and Educational Sciences)

name: RBelgium meeting 5 @ UGent

description:

SCHEDULE

• Marcel Remon from the Department of Mathematics (UNamur) will be talking about his research projects


• Grégoire Gauriot from LondonR and from Mango-Solutions

“Oracle R Enterprise - What can it do for me?”


CARPOOL

People wishing to attend the meeting but requiring a lift to Namur, may post a carpool request in the message box below.
name: RBelgium meeting 6 @ UNamur

description:
We have the pleasure to announce that the Centre for Information Management, Modeling and Simulation , KU Leuven@HUBrussel, will be hosting the 7th RBelgium regular meeting! We are grateful to them for organizing this meeting !

-- Sandwiches, snacks and drinks will be provided during the meeting (thanks to HUBrussel)

SCHEDULE

• AiR Quality Monitoring – An alternative way for data analysis and visualization (Spanu Laurent & Lenartz Fabian - Institut scientifique de service public)

• Probabilistic latent feature analysis with the pflm package (Michel Meulders - Centre for Information Management, Modeling and Simulation, KU Leuven@ HUBrussel)

• Analysis and visualisation of climate data from the atmospheric model ALADIN using the Rfa package (Rozemien De Troch - Onderzoeksdepartement KMI)


CARPOOL

People wishing to attend the meeting but requiring a lift to Brussels, may post a carpool request in the message box below.


PARKING

Parking lot is available for RBelgium visitors.


ENGLISH

In the parking, you first log on to the console as follows: 

* you press on button 1

* you should see a green arrow light 

* you press the button below

* putting you in touch with someone from the Reception who will open the gate

Be careful: the height of the garage is 1m80


DUTCH

In de garage meldt u zich aan het eerste bedieningspaneel als volgt aan:

* u drukt op knop nr 1

* bijgevolg zal er een groene pijl oplichten

* u drukt de knop eronder in

* waardoor u in contact wordt gesteld met een collega van het Onthaal die vervolgens de poort voor u opent

Opgelet: de hoogte van de garage is 1m80


HOW TO REACH


The room of the talks will be 'multimedialokaal 6303' at the Hermes III building (6th floor).


To find it:

ENGLISH


- first possibility: go to the main entrance (Stormstraat 2)

Take the lift to the 3rd floor

Turn left (90°) when getting out the lift

Follow the central hall and go straight through the building until the end of hall, then turn right and immediately after turn left ... you've reached the Hermes III building.

Attention: when you get from one building to the other, you jump one floor (4th instead of 3rd): buildings are not at the same level (Stormstraat below).


Take the stairs to the 6th floor. You get to an open space with behind on the left an access to room 6306.

- second possibility: go further after Stormstraat 2 until the bottom of the street

Nearly at the bottom of the street, you see HUBrussel in front of the Radisson SAS Hotel.

Take the last HUBrussel entrance (just in front of the underground HUBrussel parking lot).  Street is there  Warmoesberg and the entrance is 43.


Take the lift to the 6th floor (you are in the right building).

Out of the lift you enter an open space with behind on the left an access to room 6306.

DUTCH

- OPLOSSING 1: ga naar de hoofdingang (Stormstraat 2):

neem de lift naar het 3de verdiep

ga links (90°) zodra U uit de lift komt, volg de centrale hal en ga door het gebouw ... tot je niet meer kan, dan rechtsaf en dan onmiddellijk naar links, daar ben je in het gebouw Hermes III

LET OP: op het ogenblik dat U van het ene gebouw in het andere komt, gaat U direct verdieping 3 naar de 4 (de 2 gebouwen hebben niet dezelfde opbouw, gezien de Stormstraat erg steil naar beneden loopt)

Neem de trap naar de zesde verdieping. Je komt in een open ruimte met achteraan links lokaal 6303.


- OPLOSSING 2: zet uw weg verder na Stormstraat nr. 2 en ga (omlaag) tot onderaan de straat:

HERKENNINGSPUNT: bijna beneden, ziet U aan de voorkant van HUBrussel het Radisson SAS Hotel

neem de laatste HUBrussel ingang (net voor de laatste ondergrondse HUBrussel garage) - let op: de straat is daar Warmoesberg en het is ingang 43

neem de lift naar de 6de verdieping : je bent direct in het juiste gebouw uit de lift komt u  in een open ruimte met achteraan links lokaal 6303.

venue.name: Centre for Information Management, Modeling and Simulation

name: RBelgium meeting 7 KU Leuven@HUBrussel

description:
We have the pleasure to announce that the Department of Biology, @UAntwerpen, will be hosting the 8th RBelgium regular meeting!

We are grateful to them for organizing this meeting !

SCHEDULE

• Not-too-bad practices in managing R in batch mode: Laurent Franckx (VITO - www.vito.be)

• How to properly manage R package repositories: Tobias (Openanalytics - www.openanalytics.eu)


• Introduction to Renjin, the R interpreter for the JVM (Maarten-Jan Kallen - http://www.bedatadriven.com)

Topics: Why an alternative interpreter and what are the differences in design and philosophy between the many interpreters (e.g. Renjin, pqR, FastR, and TERR) currently under development? General overview of the Renjin project: when should you (not) use Renjin, how to get started, how to use packages, etc. Demo: creating a simple Java application with Renjin + creating a Java web application with Renjin in Google Appengine (= scalable R interpreter in the cloud!).

Mark to all the foodies out there. There will be no sandwiches, only drinks this time.

• Q&A session (see below for more info... there is some prize to win !)

Q&A SESSION


The Q&A Rbelgium aims at creating more interactivity between the members by letting us exchange ideas via a Question & Answer page. 


Members who have a question relating to R can post it on the Q&A page and Members who have a answer to it and want to share it can then post their answer. 


The questions posted have got to be clear and R-related of course. We would also like that each question posted be identified clearly by a "hashtag" description so that people who post an answer can use that "# description" in their text  to link it to the right question.

Here are two  examples of questions: 

1." #Jhon_years_sequence:

I have a vector A containing years: eg.

A <- c(1978, 1979, 1980, 1981, 1984, 1987,1988,1989,1990,1991, 1992

I would like to be able to count the sequence of years before a year is missed out. So I would be looking for my answer to be : 4, 1, 6

Can anyone help me out as I am drawing a blank. I know about using rle for sequences of repeated numbers but not sure what to do here."

or as another example, a question of a more "methodological/general" order:


2."#Clara_clustering_visualization:

What package /function or process would you recommend to visualize the results of a clustering analysis. I want to understand intuitively in one graph the important differences between the different clusters based on the variables used as input to define the clusters."


At each RBelgium meeting we  will present the "best" or "most interesting" or "most efficient" answer which will be selected by the Rbelgium organizing committee.  The  " winner" would better attend as she/he will receive a prize :-).


Prize: FNAC 50eur voucher offered by jcpanalytics (jcpanalytics@gmail.com)
how_to_find_us: Campus Groenenborger (Berchem), lokaal U 024. More info on  https://www.uantwerpen.be/nl/campusleven/op-weg-naar-de-campus/campus-groenenborger/
name: RBelgium meeting 8 @ Departement Biologie Univ. Antwerpen
